intro: Rhododendron propinquum, commonly known as the close relative or near relative rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in cool, humid climates at high elevations. The plant features dense, leathery leaves and produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and ecologically important plants. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
